children.text: The drawings we have been provided with show the set-back from the front and side boundary etc, which we have check measured, and can confirm that it closely matches what has been documented on the drawings.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.03 Setting out the site states that
‘A building set out is defective where the set out has failed to comply with the requirements of the approved drawings’
, and clause 2.06 Building dimensions states that

‘Departures from documented set out for external elements such as garages, carports, verandahs, decks, patios, etc. are defects if they exceed L/100 or 5 mm, whichever is the greater, where L is the documented dimension’ .
This item is to confirm that the house set-back is correct (within the allowable tolerances), and there is no action required from the builder in relation to this issue.
